div.p: TXEA will be providing meals for TXEA students Every Monday 9am – 1:30pm. Meal packages will include breakfast and lunch for five days, including meal prep instructions. Distribution will be at the Texas Empowerment Academy Secondary Campus,
Questions may be directed to updates@txea.org

h1.span: The health and safety of our students and staff is our highest priority. As concerns over the spread of COVID-19 grow across the country, please know that we share your concerns. In response to the developing and rapidly-changing situation and in consideration of maximizing ways to further prevent the risk of exposure to COVID-19, Texas Empowerment Academy will be closed indefinitely.
We will continue to monitor the situation but in general will
follow Austin ISD’s schedule. Please continue to practice safe and healthy measures at home to keep you and your children healthy during this time.
Thank you for the continued care and concern you’ve shown our students and staff as we cope with an evolving health situation.

span.strong: Find out more about online classes

div.span: We are pleased to inform you that the educational instruction of your child will continue during our school closure in response to the COVID19 virus pandemic. Please click the link below for more information.

div.p: Texas Empowerment Academy (TEA) was founded in 1998 as a mechanism to provide children with an innovative alternative for educational excellence in grades K-12. Since its inception, The Academy has grown into a jewel in East Austin where primarily African-American students of all labels (i.e., at risk, special education, gifted and talented, economically disadvantaged and Title 1) attend.
